abstract.text: Methods that create downstream publishers or subscribers to act on the elements they receive.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use operators to assemble a chain of republishers, optionally ending with a subscriber, that processes elements produced by upstream publishers. Each operator creates and configures an instance of a
, and subscribes it to the publisher that you call the method on.
In the following example, a sequence publisher emits the integers 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. A
publisher to only republish even values. A second operator creates a

subscriber to print out each value received. The sink subscriber automatically subscribes to the filter publisher, at which point the filter publisher subscribes to its upstream publisher, the sequence publisher.

Combine-PageImage-card.png.alt: The Swift language logo, overlaid by a graph of interconnected lines and points.

abstract.text: Customize handling of asynchronous events by combining event-processing operators.
Declares that a type can transmit a sequence of values over time.
Republishes all elements that match a provided closure.
A namespace for types that serve as publishers.
A publisher that buffers elements from an upstream publisher.
Publishes a single Boolean value that indicates whether all received elements pass a given predicate.
Appends a publisher’s output with the specified elements.
Raises a fatal error when its upstream publisher fails, and otherwise republishes all received input.
Republishes elements received from a publisher, by assigning them to a property marked as a publisher.
Assigns each element from a publisher to a property on an object.
Raises a debugger signal when a provided closure needs to stop the process in the debugger.
Raises a debugger signal upon receiving a failure.
Buffers elements received from an upstream publisher.
Handles errors from an upstream publisher by replacing it with another publisher.
Collects all received elements, and emits a single array of the collection when the upstream publisher finishes.
Collects up to the specified number of elements, and then emits a single array of the collection.
Collects elements by a given time-grouping strategy, and emits a single array of the collection.
Subscribes to an additional publisher and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from either publisher.
Subscribes to two additional publishers and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
Subscribes to an additional publisher and invokes a closure upon receiving output from either publisher.
Subscribes to two additional publishers and invokes a closure upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
Subscribes to three additional publishers and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
Subscribes to three additional publishers and invokes a closure upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
Calls a closure with each received element and publishes any returned optional that has a value.
Publishes a Boolean value upon receiving an element equal to the argument.
Publishes a Boolean value upon receiving an element that satisfies the predicate closure.
Publishes the number of elements received from the upstream publisher.
Publishes elements only after a specified time interval elapses between events.
Decodes the output from the upstream using a specified decoder.
Delays delivery of all output to the downstream receiver by a specified amount of time on a particular scheduler.
Ignores elements from the upstream publisher until it receives an element from a second publisher.
Omits elements from the upstream publisher until a given closure returns false, before republishing all remaining elements.
Omits the specified number of elements before republishing subsequent elements.
Encodes the output from upstream using a specified encoder.
Wraps this publisher with a type eraser.
Republishes all elements that match a provided closure.
Publishes the first element of a stream, then finishes.
Publishes the first element of a stream to satisfy a predicate closure, then finishes normally.
Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
Performs the specified closures when publisher events occur.
Ignores all upstream elements, but passes along the upstream publisher’s completion state (finished or failed).
Publishes the last element of a stream, after the stream finishes.
Publishes the last element of a stream that satisfies a predicate closure, after upstream finishes.
Creates a connectable wrapper around the publisher.
Publishes the value of a key path.
Transforms all elements from the upstream publisher with a provided closure.
Publishes the values of two key paths as a tuple.
Publishes the values of three key paths as a tuple.
Converts any failure from the upstream publisher into a new error.
Publishes the maximum value received from the upstream publisher, after it finishes.
Publishes the maximum value received from the upstream publisher, using the provided ordering closure.
Measures and emits the time interval between events received from an upstream publisher.
Combines elements from this publisher with those from another publisher of the same type, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
Combines elements from this publisher with those from two other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
Combines elements from this publisher with those from three other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
Combines elements from this publisher with those from four other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
Combines elements from this publisher with those from five other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
Combines elements from this publisher with those from six other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
Combines elements from this publisher with those from seven other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
Publishes the minimum value received from the upstream publisher, after it finishes.
Publishes the minimum value received from the upstream publisher, after it finishes.
Applies a closure to create a subject that delivers elements to subscribers.
Provides a subject to deliver elements to multiple subscribers.
Publishes a specific element, indicated by its index in the sequence of published elements.
Publishes elements specified by their range in the sequence of published elements.
Republishes elements up to the specified maximum count.
Republishes elements until another publisher emits an element.
Republishes elements while a predicate closure indicates publishing should continue.
Prefixes a publisher’s output with the specified values.
Prints log messages for all publishing events.
Specifies the scheduler on which to receive elements from the publisher.
Attaches the specified subscriber to this publisher.
Applies a closure that collects each element of a stream and publishes a final result upon completion.
Publishes only elements that don’t match the previous element.
Publishes only elements that don’t match the previous element, as evaluated by a provided closure.
Replaces an empty stream with the provided element.
Replaces any errors in the stream with the provided element.
Replaces nil elements in the stream with the provided element.
Attempts to recreate a failed subscription with the upstream publisher up to the number of times you specify.
Transforms elements from the upstream publisher by providing the current
element to a closure along with the last value returned by the closure.
Changes the failure type declared by the upstream publisher.
Shares the output of an upstream publisher with multiple subscribers.
Attaches a subscriber with closure-based behavior.
Attaches a subscriber with closure-based behavior to a publisher that never fails.
Attaches the specified subscriber to this publisher.
Attaches the specified subject to this publisher.
Specifies the scheduler on which to perform subscribe, cancel, and request operations.
Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
Publishes either the most-recent or first element published by the upstream publisher in the specified time interval.
Terminates publishing if the upstream publisher exceeds the specified time interval without producing an element.
Publishes a single Boolean value that indicates whether all received elements pass a given error-throwing predicate.
Handles errors from an upstream publisher by either replacing it with another publisher or throwing a new error.
Calls an error-throwing closure with each received element and publishes any returned optional that has a value.
Publishes a Boolean value upon receiving an element that satisfies the throwing predicate closure.
Omits elements from the upstream publisher until an error-throwing closure returns false, before republishing all remaining elements.
Republishes all elements that match a provided error-throwing closure.
Publishes the first element of a stream to satisfy a throwing predicate closure, then finishes normally.
Publishes the last element of a stream that satisfies an error-throwing predicate closure, after the stream finishes.
Transforms all elements from the upstream publisher with a provided error-throwing closure.
Publishes the maximum value received from the upstream publisher, using the provided error-throwing closure to order the items.
Publishes the minimum value received from the upstream publisher, using the provided error-throwing closure to order the items.
Republishes elements while an error-throwing predicate closure indicates publishing should continue.
Applies an error-throwing closure that collects each element of a stream and publishes a final result upon completion.
Publishes only elements that don’t match the previous element, as evaluated by a provided error-throwing closure.
Transforms elements from the upstream publisher by providing the current element to an error-throwing closure along with the last value returned by the closure.
Combines elements from another publisher and deliver pairs of elements as tuples.
Combines elements from two other publishers and delivers groups of elements as tuples.
Combines elements from another publisher and delivers a transformed output.
Combines elements from three other publishers and delivers groups of elements as tuples.
Combines elements from two other publishers and delivers a transformed output.
Combines elements from three other publishers and delivers a transformed output.
A publisher that republishes all elements that match a provided closure.
A protocol that declares a type that can receive input from a publisher.
A simple subscriber that requests an unlimited number of values upon subscription.

topicSections.title: Collecting and Republishing the Latest Elements from Multiple Publishers
Republishing Elements from Multiple Publishers as an Interleaved Stream
Collecting and Republishing the Oldest Unconsumed Elements from Multiple Publishers
Republishing Elements by Subscribing to New Publishers
